column2: Role & responsibilities  :   We are seeking a dedicated and results-driven Account Manager to join our team at Parity Technology Solutions India. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing and nurturing relationships with our existing clients in the hospitality industry, driving revenue growth, and ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction.   Key Responsibilities: Client Relationship Management: Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned client accounts, building strong and enduring relationships based on trust and reliability. Understand the unique needs and objectives of each client and develop tailored solutions to address their specific requirements. Conduct regular check-ins with clients to gather feedback, address concerns, and identify opportunities for upselling or cross-selling additional services. Account Growth and Revenue Generation: Develop strategic account plans to expand business opportunities within existing client accounts and achieve revenue targets. Collaborate with internal teams, including Sales, Marketing, and Technical Support, to identify new sales opportunities and drive customer engagement. Negotiate contract renewals, pricing agreements, and service level agreements to maximize profitability and ensure long-term client retention. Project Management and Implementation: Work closely with the Project Management team to ensure the successful implementation and delivery of project to client sites. Coordinate with clients and internal stakeholders to define project scope, timelines, and deliverables, ensuring alignment with client expectations and company capabilities. Monitor project progress and address any issues or concerns that may arise during the implementation phase, maintaining a high level of quality and customer satisfaction. Customer Support and Satisfaction: Act as a trusted advisor to clients, providing proactive support and guidance on product features, best practices, and troubleshooting techniques. Respond promptly to client inquiries and service requests, resolving issues in a timely and efficient manner to ensure a positive customer experience. Conduct periodic service reviews with clients to review performance metrics, discuss service improvements, and gather feedback for continuous enhancement. Market Intelligence and Industry Insights: Stay informed about industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging technologies within the hospitality sector. Share market insights and customer feedback with internal teams to inform product development, marketing strategies, and sales initiatives. Preferred candidate profile:   Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Hospitality Management, or a related field. MBA is a plus. Proven experience in account management, sales, or business development, preferably within the technology or hospitality industry. Strong relationship-building skills with the ability to effectively engage with clients at various levels of the organization. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts in a clear and concise manner. Strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities, with a focus on driving results and exceeding customer expectations. Proficiency in CRM software, Microsoft Office Suite, and other relevant business tools. Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team in a fast-paced environment. Perks and benefits

Each Executive Education programme is designed to address the distinct needs of specific organizations or of executives at various points in their career, helping them up-skill and progress. A significant part of the portfolio consists of engagements for designing and conducting customized executive programmes for different organisations - corporates, government, public sector undertakings, educational institutions, regulatory bodies, etc. The aim is to address their specific requirements and provide them with suitable development interventions and strategic solutions. The training modules for these programmes are designed in close association with our clients to ensure value added delivery. Some of these organizations also nominate people for our Open Enrollment programmes. The Executive Education Office requires an ambitious and energetic individual, who has the ability to contribute to the outreach and growth of IIMAs Executive Education portfolio and a vibrant client network. It is a unique, creative opportunity for the right candidate to promote relevant and interesting programs among the management community, to gain valuable experience of Executive Education in the corporate/organized sectors. The Manager  Client Relationships, Executive Education Programme Office will report to the Chief Operating Officer  Executive Education. Job   Description   and   Key   Responsibilities: ??Identifying B2B opportunities and growth areas, create connections especially with L&D leaders and convert leads into long-term client relationships for IIMA. ??Managing and strengthening partnerships with the existing client list of Executive Education Programme Office. ??Maintaining the IIMAs Brand image and focus across all interactions and retain a continual sense of the competitive landscape. ??Ensuring enrolment and nomination of participants from blue chip organizations for more than 100 annual executive education programmes. ??Efficient and responsive communication with programme faculty and the clients. ??Interact with faculty members to understand their programme ideas and devise communication approaches for market impact. ??Work with internal team to identify and convert opportunities for cross and up selling. ??Creating effective outreach: Conducting events and information seminars/webinars. Essential   Qualifications,   Experience   &   Skill   Requirements: ??Proficient in written and verbal communication. ??Proficient in MS Office and other productivity tools. ??Ability to quickly comprehend client needs and translate them into actionable agenda. ??Knowledge of digital marketing tools will be an advantage. ??MBA/PGDM (full time) in general management/marketing/advertising from a reputed Institute. ??Minimum 5 years of experience in a business development role in the B2B domain. It is desirable if the experience is in the executive education related industry or in solution selling or advisory firms. ??The candidate should have strong communication and relationship building skills, leadership potential, agility and enthusiasm. Candidate should have demonstrated capability of being a team player and be resourceful in managing challenges. Age:  Maximum 40 years as on last date of Application. The institute provides age relaxation as per GOI rules. Additional 5 years age relaxation is given to women candidates. Salary   &   Allowances:  Selected candidates will be offered an appointment on a Tenure Based Scaled Contract for a fixed term of three years, which may be extended for a further period as required. Based on the experience and qualification, the selected candidate will be placed in Pay Level 10 under the pay matrix of 7th Central Pay Commission. Beside the salary as per the 7th CPC, the Institute offers other benefits which are at par with the permanent employees. To apply please visit the link  https://www.iima.ac.in/the-institute/administration/working-with-us  and select the respective position latest by  May 22, 2024

column2: Role Description: Key Account Manager with Architects #   Key   Responsibilities 1. Relationship Management:  - Develop and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with architectural firms and key stakeholders within those firms.  - Act as the primary point of contact between the company and architects, ensuring their needs and expectations are met.  - Conduct regular meetings with architects to understand their project requirements, timelines, and budgets. 2. Account Growth and Retention:  - Identify opportunities to expand business with existing architectural accounts through upselling and cross-selling relevant products and services. - Develop tailored solutions and proposals that align with architects' specific project needs. - Monitor client satisfaction and implement strategies to retain and grow key accounts. 3. Strategic Planning:  - Collaborate with senior management to align account strategies with the companys overall business goals and market positioning.  - Analyze market trends, project pipelines, and competitor activities to anticipate architects' needs and inform strategic decisions.  - Develop and execute strategic account plans that drive business growth within the architectural sector. 4. Sales and Negotiation:  - Lead contract negotiations with architectural firms to ensure mutually beneficial agreements.  - Prepare and present detailed proposals and presentations to architects, highlighting the benefits and features of the company's products and services.  - Achieve sales targets and key performance indicators (KPIs) through effective account management and relationship building. 5. Cross-Functional Collaboration:  - Work closely with internal teams, including product development, marketing, and customer service, to ensure architects' requirements are met.  - Facilitate communication between the architects and internal teams to address and resolve any project-related issues or challenges.  - Collaborate with marketing to create targeted campaigns and materials that resonate with architectural clients. 6. Technical Support and Training:  - Provide architects with technical support and training on the companys products and services.  - Organise workshops, seminars, and product demonstrations to educate architects on new offerings and industry best practices.    - Stay updated on the latest architectural trends, materials, and technologies to provide relevant advice and solutions. 7. Reporting and Analysis:  - Track account performance and provide regular reports to senior management.  - Use customer relationship management (CRM) systems to maintain accurate client records and track interactions.  - Analyse sales data, project outcomes, and client feedback to continuously improve account management strategies. #   Key   Skills   and   Competencies - Relationship Building: Ability to establish trust and rapport with architectural firms and key stakeholders. - Industry Knowledge: In-depth knowledge of the architecture and construction industry, including materials, design trends, and project management. - Strategic Thinking: Skill in developing long-term plans that align with architects' needs and company objectives. - Sales Acumen: Strong understanding of sales processes, negotiation techniques, and revenue generation within the architectural sector. - Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills for effective client interactions and internal collaboration. - Problem-Solving: Ability to anticipate and address architects' issues proactively and provide creative solutions. - Organisational Skills: Strong organisational abilities to manage multiple accounts and projects simultaneously. - Technical Expertise: Proficiency in understanding and explaining technical aspects of products and services to architects. #   Typical   Background - Education: Bachelor?? degree in architecture, business administration, marketing, or a related field. A background in architecture or construction management is highly beneficial. - Experience: Several years of experience in account management, sales, or a related field, with a focus on working with architectural firms or within the architecture industry. - Industry Knowledge: Comprehensive understanding of the architecture and construction industry, including current trends, materials, and technologies. #   Goals   and   Objectives - Client Satisfaction: Maintain high levels of client satisfaction and loyalty among architectural firms. - Revenue Growth: Achieve revenue growth targets through effective management and development of key architectural accounts. - Market Position: Strengthen the company?? market position within the architecture sector by building strong client relationships and delivering exceptional service. In summary, a Key Account Manager working with architects plays a pivotal role in driving business growth by managing and nurturing relationships with architectural firms, ensuring their needs are met, and aligning account strategies with overall business objectives.
